solution.text:
Since for the first 5 years, it follows simple interest, the amount due after 5 years becomes the principal for the 6th year.
Therefore SI for 5 years =\( (P \times R \times T) \)/100 = _{{50000*j}}_ x 10 x 5/100 = Rs. _{{25000*j}}_
Amount = P+SI = _{{50000*j}}_ + _{{25000*j}}_ = Rs. _{{75000*j}}_
New principal (P2) = Rs. _{{75000*j}}_
New time period (T2) = 6-5 = 1 year
Rate = 10%
Hence by compound interest formula,\( A= P \times (1 + (R/100))^T = P2 \times (1+ (R/100))^{T2} \)
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore Final amount due after 6 years = \( _{{75000*j}}_ \times (1 + (10/100))^1 \)= Rs. _{{82500*j}}_

content.text: Assuming that he repaid the loan after 6 years, what is the amount he would have to repay the hospital?
